summary: The Royal Challengers Bangalore are a franchise cricket team based in Bangalore, Karnataka, that plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL)

value.label: This four decade old stadium is situated in the heart of the city of Bengaluru

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label:
The team won only 4 of the 14 matches in the inaugural season, finishing seventh in the eight-team table.

In the 2009 season, they were able to reach the finals, losing to Deccan Chargers by six runs in a tense finish.

In the 2010 season,  the Royal Challengers were defeated by the table-toppers Mumbai Indians by 35 runs in the semi-final

In the 2011 auction, Royal Challengers retained only one of their players, Virat Kohli. West Indian batsman Chris Gayle and South African batsman AB de Villiers was brought in.

In the 2011 season, The Royal Challengers qualified for the finals but lost to Chennai at their home ground.

In the 2012 season, a batting failure at Hyderabad in RCB’s final game of the season led to the end of the team’s campaign, making it the first time since 2009 that they failed to qualify for both the play-offs and the Champions League.

In the 2013 season, they again did not qualify for the playoffs.

In the 2014 season, they ended up 7th in the points table and didn't qualify for the playoffs.

In the 2015 season, they lost to the Chennai Super Kings in the Qualifier 2, and ended the season finishing third.

In the 2016 season, they played the final against SRH, again in Bengaluru. RCB lost a hard fought match by 8 runs, to end as runners up in this ninth season of the IPL.

In the 2017 season, they ended up at the bottom of the table with 10 losses and 3 wins.

In the 2018 season, they did not advance to the playoffs.
Virat Kohli set the record for most runs (973) in an IPL season in 2016.

value.label: Rahul Dravid was the team's icon player in 2008.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: In a single match against Pune Warriors India saw Chris Gayle smash 175 off just 66 balls which was the highest individual score in T20 cricket and RCB put up 263-5 which was the highest total in T20 cricket.

facts.label: What goes up, also comes down!

value.label: In their  game against Kolkata Knight Riders, they were bundled out for 49 all out which is the lowest IPL score and also where no batsman could score 10 run.
The 2017 season of the Indian Premier League, also known as IPL 10 and branded as Vivo IPL 2017, was the tenth edition of the IPL
